content: A large computer spy ring was discovered when the Dali Lama suggested that one of his computers had been hacked. Computer experts digging into the claim discovered a computer spy ring that has hacked into sites all over the world in a way that would give them access to files, accounts, cameras etc... The Ghost of Mao is watching you - - http://www.rushmoredrive.com/LatestNews/Massive_electronic_spying_traced_to_China.aspx?ArticleId=5074839438920751527 "The newly reported spying operation is by far the largest to come to light in terms of countries affected. The malware is remarkable both for its sweep — in computer jargon, it has not been merely "phishing" for random consumers' information, but "whaling" for particular important targets — and for its Big Brother-style capacities. It can, for example, turn on the camera and audio-recording functions of an infected computer, enabling monitors to see and hear what goes on in a room." I think this pretty much defines where the biggest threat lies - - Wandering and Wondering

content: The concept that passive audio/visual equipment can be used to spy on the owner sounds Orwellian, but he did warn us about it clear back in 1948 with his book, 1984. The fact is, anything that can transmit a sound can also be used to listen, because the receiver and speaker in something like a phone work on the same principles. So, all the computers, phones and televisions hooked into a central network could be controlled to ease-drop and give up information from all those devices all the time by anyone savvy enough to make it happen... The assumption of privacy and protection is a joke - - Wandering and Wondering

content: but the threat still there. china is expanding the cyber war to new levels. they got whole schools training soldiers how to hack. They are attacking almost every country defense system and hacking in company's to steal weapon designs. It's pretty scary stuff if you think about how much damage a online attack can have on the world. I always believe that if china was going to go to war with anyone. They would push up there direct attacks on that one country's defense system until they are overwhelming it and till they get in and see and screw something up in it. There nothing worst then knowing they can see where your men are and what there going to do before any war starts.And whats even scary is they could do this days before any major attack coming in giving them the advantage in any war.

content: Nuclear weapons are becoming outdated as a deterrent. China is teaching us (if we'll pay attention) that cyber-warfare and economic warfare are how 21st century wars will be fought - and won. Think back to the third Taiwan Straits Crisis. Would we feel as secure inviting war with China now as we did then? Who cares about their nucs? They can destroy our way of life without a single explosion. It has the added benefit of no environmental impact. It's the ultimate weapon of asymmetric warfare.
